intro: Oldenlandia brachypetala, commonly known as the short-petalled spiderling, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that often have five petals and are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Oldenlandia brachypetala thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
